Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2014 12:22AM KarenNY wrote: hi ladies.  ebla - your numbers sound great, especially after only 3 months.  Two weeks ago my bc marker was at 1,700.  I can only imagine how much higher it got in the last 2 weeks.  I heard from my onc today.  Set to start tomorrow with the Halaven.  I'm hoping to get the success you have all had on it.  Let's hope Halaven continues to work its magic for all of us.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2014 04:38PM KarenNY wrote: SophieJean - I am on my second cycle.  Appetite is gone, living on liquids.  My white count continues to be low, and I get 4 shots of Neupogen a week.  Upside is that it is working and some of my original  side effects are gone.  The one week off is a blessing,  I actually feel like myself and can eat.  Even the tired/weakness is better.  So hang in there. I'm hoping we both get more energy as this treatment continues.  Wishing you the best.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2014 05:35PM KarenNY wrote: Welcome Sue. Hoping Halaven treats you very well :)
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2014 01:39PM KarenNY wrote: Looks like Halaven and I will be having a short run.  Blood counts continue to dip each week even with Neopogen shots.  I had a fever this week of 102.9 and was admitted to the hospital for 4 days.  The neuropathy has now left me unable to walk without assistance and going up and down stairs unaided is impossible.  So my oncologist said I will have to change chemos.  Feel bad to say goodbye to Halaven since it's working, but my side effects are out of control.   Good luck to the rest of you.  It seems like Halaven has been kinder to you.  Wishing you continued good results on this drug.  Karen
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Thanks again for your help.  Karen

Might have to ask my onc about that one.

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2014 01:04AM KarenNY wrote: Hey Jean.  I have been dealing with nausea for two weeks now.  I've tried Zofran, Ativan, compazine, and kytril.  None seem to give me total relief.  My oncologist suggested ginger tea or root.  I'll try anything- it is definitely one of the worst feelings.  Do they make you go for an EKG each week when you get your bloodwork done?  That's one thing I never had to do.  I also have to continue with the neupogen shot , just one to keep my counts up.  I've only had one treatment so far and I'm cautiously waiting for  side effects. Hoping they won't be too bad.  I'm also hoping the Halaven knocks out your lung mets completely.  Wishing you all the best.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 01:04PM KarenNY wrote: Jean I heard that when you get a zapping pain, the tumors are breaking down.  Believe it or not, my most successful treatment was Taxol and that happened all the time.  You are so lucky to have good blood counts.  I've had 5 neupogen shots in a week and a half and my count is still low.  Too tired to go anywhere except doctor's office.  Looking forward to Halaven working.  Be well.

Krystyna, so glad this is working on your liver mets.  I had the same diagnosis.  Good luck with your treatments.

Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2014 12:04AM KarenNY wrote: I agree JimmieBell, we can all compare notes and be each other's support system.  When I was on Taxol last year, my scan showed that the cancer was practically undetectable.  Next step was Faslodex, then Abraxane which kicked my butt.  Back to Taxol which stopped working, then Navelbine which didn't work either.  So disappointing.  So much time wasted while the cancer kept growing.  Now both of my lobes in the liver have mets.  I have nausea, low grade fever and my ribs are hurting.  So I really need Halaven to work.  It's making me crazy too waiting for this new med.  Praying that we all have good results.  We deserve it!
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2014 01:16AM KarenNY wrote: Hey Ladies.  Onc changed my shots from one to two a week.  So far after one treatment getting some zings in my toes and a sour taste.   I'm hoping next week's  bloodwork is good and onc will change it to one shot a week.  Hope you all had a good week.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 09:06PM KarenNY wrote: I was encouraged by gritgirl's comment about 4 women living with liver mets 10 years already. I was diagnosed in 2006 with stage IIA then rediagnosed in 2012 with stage IV when it went to my liver. I was dealing with nausea but no other symptoms. After having my liver biopsies I developed a fever which lasted a few weeks. After my first round of Taxol, my fever and nausea disappeared. Taxol worked well for me, then I tried Faslodex. That didn't work, so I'm now taking abraxane which is working but has totally killed my taste buds/appetite. I never had any pain in my liver until I had the biopsies.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL
